00181 /**
00182  Function:        SchemaInit
00183  PreCondition:    UDP initalised, XPL initalised
00184  Side Effects:    None
00185  Overview:
00186  General initalisiation procedure for any xPL schema(s).
00187  Set inital variables and system state after startup. Assumes TCIP is available and xPL configured.
00188  Returns FALSE if the default config options were loaded
00189 
00190  @param           None
00191  @result          BOOL, is the device configured
00192  */
00193 BOOL SchemaInit (void) {
00194 
00195         BOOL ReturnResult = TRUE;
00196         char TempVal[4];
00197         BYTE * ptr;
00198 
00199 
00200         //Load configuration data
00201         if (xPLLoadEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig)) == FALSE) {
00202                 //EE data incorrect
00203 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00204                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" # NOTE# ZoneConfig Loaded default Security Settings\r\n");
00205 #endif
00206                 ReturnResult = FALSE;
00207         }
00208 
00209 
00210         if (xPLLoadEEConfig(&xPLConfig, EEDATASTART_XPL, sizeof(xPLConfig)) == FALSE) {
00211                 //EE data incorrect
00212 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00213                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" # NOTE# xPLConfig Loaded default Security Settings\r\n");
00214 #endif
00215                 ReturnResult = FALSE;
00216         }
00217 
00218 
00219         if (xPLLoadEEConfig(AreaConfig, EEDATASTART_AREA, sizeof(AreaConfig)) == FALSE) {
00220                 //EE data incorrect
00221 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00222                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" # NOTE# AreaConfig Loaded default Security Settings\r\n");
00223 #endif
00224                 ReturnResult = FALSE;
00225         }
00226 
00227         if (ReturnResult == FALSE) LoadDefaultConfig();
00228 
00229 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00230 
00231         ultoa ((unsigned int) sizeof(AppConfig), TempVal);
00232         putrsUART((ROM char*)"IP AppConfig  size: ");
00233         putsUART(TempVal);
00234         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EEStarts:");
00235         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_CONFIG, TempVal);
00236         putsUART(TempVal);
00237         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EESize: ");
00238         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_XPL - (unsigned int)EEDATASTART_CONFIG, TempVal);
00239         putsUART(TempVal);
00240 
00241         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00242 
00243         ultoa ((unsigned int) sizeof(xPLConfig), TempVal);
00244         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Security Schema xPLConfig size: ");
00245         putsUART(TempVal);
00246         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EEStarts:");
00247         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_XPL, TempVal);
00248         putsUART(TempVal);
00249         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EESize: ");
00250         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_ZONE - (unsigned int)EEDATASTART_XPL, TempVal);
00251         putsUART(TempVal);
00252         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00253 
00254         ultoa ((unsigned int) sizeof(ZoneConfig), TempVal);
00255         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Security Schema ZoneConfig size: ");
00256         putsUART(TempVal);
00257         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EEStarts:");
00258         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_ZONE, TempVal);
00259         putsUART(TempVal);
00260         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EESize: ");
00261         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_AREA - (unsigned int)EEDATASTART_ZONE, TempVal);
00262         putsUART(TempVal);
00263         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00264 
00265         ultoa ((unsigned int) sizeof(AreaConfig), TempVal);
00266         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Security Schema AreaConfig size: ");
00267         putsUART(TempVal);
00268         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EEStarts:");
00269         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_AREA, TempVal);
00270         putsUART(TempVal);
00271         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EESize: ");
00272         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_USER - (unsigned int)EEDATASTART_AREA, TempVal);
00273         putsUART(TempVal);
00274         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00275 
00276 
00277         ultoa ((unsigned int) USERCOUNT * (USERNAMELENGTH + USERPASSLENGTH) , TempVal);
00278         putrsUART((ROM char*)"User size: ");
00279         putsUART(TempVal);
00280         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EEStarts:");
00281         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_USER, TempVal);
00282         putsUART(TempVal);
00283         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EESize: ");
00284         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC - (unsigned int)EEDATASTART_USER, TempVal);
00285         putsUART(TempVal);
00286         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00287 
00288 
00289         ultoa ((unsigned int) DEVICEDESCLENGTH * (ZONECOUNT + AREACOUNT) , TempVal);
00290         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Device desc size: ");
00291         putsUART(TempVal);
00292         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EEStarts:");
00293         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC, TempVal);
00294         putsUART(TempVal);
00295         putrsUART((ROM char*)" EESize: ");
00296         ultoa ((unsigned int) EEDATASTART_MPFS - (unsigned int)EEDATASTART_DEVICEDESC, TempVal);
00297         putsUART(TempVal);
00298         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00299 
00300 
00301         //EEDATASTART_MPFS
00302 
00303 
00304 
00305 #endif
00306 
00307 
00308         //Clear timers
00309         EntryTimer = 0;
00310         TriggeredEntryZone = 0;
00311         ExitTimer = 0;
00312         NextZoneCheckDelay = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND / ZONECHECKDELAY);
00313         xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = 0;
00314         dwLastUpdateTick =0;
00315 
00316 
00317         //Set initial alarm state, arming delay and previous arm state
00318         AlarmState = Disarmed;
00319         PreviousAlarmState = Disarmed;
00320         LastZoneAlarmed = 0;
00321         BatteryState = Battery_Disconnected;
00322         memset(RejectedPassword, '\0', USERPASSLENGTH);
00323         NTPTestResponse = NTP_TEST_DONE; // result of NTP test
00324 
00325         //initalise hardware
00326         // outputs
00327         STROBE_TRIS = 0;
00328         STROBE_IO = 0;
00329         EXT_SIREN_TRIS = 0;
00330         EXT_SIREN_IO = 0;
00331         INT_SIREN_TRIS = 0;
00332         INT_SIREN_IO = 0;
00333         SLA_CHARGER_TRIS = 0;
00334         SLA_CHARGER_IO = 0;
00335 
00336         // Analogue Demulplexer
00337         PLEXERA_0_TRIS = 0;
00338         PLEXERA_1_TRIS = 0;
00339         PLEXERA_2_TRIS = 0;
00340         PLEXERA_S_TRIS = 0;
00341 
00342         PLEXERA_0_IO = 0;
00343         PLEXERA_1_IO = 0;
00344         PLEXERA_2_IO = 0;
00345 
00346 
00347         //inputs
00348         SUPPLY_ACTIVE_TRIS = 1;
00349 
00350 
00351 
00352         // SMTP state machine, send out an email stating device has been restarted
00353 
00354         SMTPTaskList.CurentTask = 0;
00355         SMTPTaskList.FreePosition = 1;
00356         SMTPTaskList.Task[0].SMTP_SendType = SMTP_Reset;
00357         SMTPTaskList.Task[0].SMTP_State = SMTP_SM_InQ;
00358         SMPTTestResult = SMTP_TEST_DONE;
00359 
00360         for (iCount = 1; iCount < SMTPSMSIZE; iCount++) {
00361                 SMTPTaskList.Task[iCount].SMTP_SendType = SMTP_Test;
00362                 SMTPTaskList.Task[iCount].SMTP_State = SMTP_SM_Done;
00363         }
00364 
00365         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
00366                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00367                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsArmed = FALSE;
00368                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
00369                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
00370                 ZoneConfig[iCount].BounceDelay = 0;
00371                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsTampered = FALSE;
00372                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE;  // should not continue state after a restart
00373         } // for
00374 
00375         for (iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
00376                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00377                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsArmed = FALSE;
00378                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
00379                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
00380                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE; // should not continue state after a restart
00381                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTampered = FALSE;
00382         } //for
00383 
00384         // xPL task buffer
00385         xPLTaskList.FreePosition = 0;
00386         xPLTaskList.CurentTask =0;
00387 
00388         // Set the TRIS flags to input for all of the A/D pins, page 331 chapter 21.0 of data sheet
00389         AN2_TRIS = 1;
00390         AN3_TRIS = 1;
00391         AN4_TRIS = 1;
00392 
00393         // Setup the A/D channels, page 329 of data sheet
00394         ADCON0 = 0b00001001;    // ADON = On(1), GO/DONE = Idle (0), AN1 selected (1000)
00395         ADCON1 = 0b00001010;    // upto AN4 enabled (1010), VCFG0 (Voltage ref) = Vdd/Vss (00)
00396         ADCON2 = 0b10111110;    // Fosc/64 (~21.0kHz) (110), 20TAD acquisition time (111), Right justify (0)
00397 
00398         // Do a calibration A/D conversion
00399         ADCON0bits.ADCAL = 1;
00400     ADCON0bits.GO = 1;
00401         while(ADCON0bits.GO);
00402         ADCON0bits.ADCAL = 0;
00403 
00404 
00405 
00406         //Queue reset email
00407         if (xPLConfig.SMTP_Active == TRUE)
00408                 SMTPQueueEmail (SMTP_Reset);
00409 
00410         //Send gateway message
00411         SendGatewayReady();
00412 
00413 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00414         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Security Schema initalised, Gateway message sent.\r\n");
00415 #endif
00416 
00417         return ReturnResult;
00418 
00419 }

00421 //*********************************************************************
00422 /**
00423  Function        LoadDefaultConfig
00424  PreCondition:    None
00425  Side Effects:    Populates ZoneConfig and AreaConfig
00426  Overview:
00427  Override any values on ZoneConfig and AreaConfig with default values
00428  @param           None
00429  @result          None
00430 
00431 */
00432 
00433 void LoadDefaultConfig (void) {
00434 
00435 
00436         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
00437                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00438                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsNO = TRUE;
00439                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsEntry = FALSE;
00440                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE;
00441                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsBypassed = FALSE;
00442                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsArmed = FALSE;
00443                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
00444                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
00445                 ZoneConfig[iCount].ZoneType = Perimiter;
00446                 ZoneConfig[iCount].ZoneAlarmType = Buglary;
00447                 ZoneConfig[iCount].AreaList = 0;
00448                 ZoneConfig[iCount].BounceDelay = 0;
00449         } // for
00450 
00451         for (iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
00452                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00453                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsTriggered = FALSE;
00454                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE;
00455                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsBypassed = FALSE;
00456                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsArmed = FALSE;
00457                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
00458                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
00459                 AreaConfig[iCount].ZoneAlarmType = Buglary;
00460         } //for
00461 
00462         ZoneConfig[0].AreaList = 0b11111111;
00463         ZoneConfig[1].AreaList = 0b00000010;
00464         ZoneConfig[2].AreaList = 0b00000100;
00465         ZoneConfig[3].AreaList = 0b00001000;
00466         ZoneConfig[4].AreaList = 0b00010000;
00467         ZoneConfig[5].AreaList = 0b00100000;
00468         ZoneConfig[6].AreaList = 0b01000000;
00469         ZoneConfig[7].AreaList = 0b10000000;
00470 
00471         for (iCount = 6; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
00472                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsBypassed = TRUE;
00473         }
00474 
00475 
00476 
00477         xPLConfig.Alarming24Duration = 18;
00478         xPLConfig.ExitDelay = 5;
00479         xPLConfig.EntryDelay = 7;
00480         xPLConfig.AlarmingDuration = 15;
00481         xPLConfig.SirenDelay = 10;
00482         xPLConfig.SirenDelay24h = 12;
00483         memset(xPLConfig.NTP_Server, '\0',sizeof(xPLConfig.NTP_Server));
00484         memcpypgm2ram(xPLConfig.NTP_Server, (ROM void*)"pool.ntp.org", 12);
00485         xPLConfig.Use_AES = FALSE;
00486 
00487 
00488         // Email
00489         memset(xPLConfig.SMTP_Server,'\0', sizeof(xPLConfig.SMTP_Server));
00490         memset(xPLConfig.SMTP_To,'\0', sizeof(xPLConfig.SMTP_To));
00491         memset(xPLConfig.SMTP_User,'\0', sizeof(xPLConfig.SMTP_User));
00492         memset(xPLConfig.SMTP_Password,'\0', sizeof(xPLConfig.SMTP_Password));
00493         xPLConfig.SMTP_Port = 21;
00494         //xPLConfig.SMTP_UseSSL = FALSE;
00495         xPLConfig.SMTP_Active = FALSE;
00496         xPLConfig.SMTP_ArmDisarm = TRUE;
00497         xPLConfig.SMTP_OnlyInitalAlarm = TRUE;
00498 
00499 
00500 
00501 } //LoadDefaultConfig

00504 //********************************************************************
00505 /**
00506  Function        xPLFactoryRestart
00507  PreCondition:    None
00508  Side Effects:    Kills the starting character of the EEProm config data
00509  Overview:
00510  Performs a factory restart of the device, clearing everything
00511  @param           None
00512  @result          None
00513 
00514 */
00515 void xPLFactoryRestart(void) {
00516         char TempVal[9];
00517 
00518 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00519         putrsUART((ROM char*)"##### Factory restart in progress #####\r\n");
00520 #endif
00521 
00522         // I dont think this will work as we do not call the StackTasks to send the message
00523 
00524         // if we have a good socket send the message, if not then do not bother
00525         if (UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
00526                 // Send header
00527                 XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_HBeat,Type_END);
00528                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "interval=0\n}\n");
00529                 // Now transmit it.
00530                 UDPFlush();
00531         }
00532 
00533 
00534     XEEBeginWrite(EEDATASTART_ZONE); // Zone config
00535     XEEWrite(0x00); // 0x00 will cause the xPLLoadEEConfig function to fail and revert to default settings.
00536     XEEEndWrite();
00537 
00538     XEEBeginWrite(EEDATASTART_AREA); // area config
00539     XEEWrite(0x00); // 0x00 will cause the xPLLoadEEConfig function to fail and revert to default settings.
00540     XEEEndWrite();
00541 
00542     XEEBeginWrite(EEDATASTART_XPL); // device config
00543     XEEWrite(0x00); // 0x00 will cause the xPLLoadEEConfig function to fail and revert to default settings.
00544     XEEEndWrite();
00545 
00546     XEEBeginWrite(EEDATASTART_CONFIG); // IP address, this is a part of the TCIP stack
00547     XEEWrite(0x00); // 0x00 will cause the xPLLoadEEConfig function to fail and revert to default settings.
00548     XEEEndWrite();
00549 
00550     while(XEEIsBusy());
00551 
00552 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00553         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Clearing config data\r\n");
00554 #endif
00555 
00556         // Blank everything
00557     for (iCount = EEDATASTART_XPL; iCount < (MPFS_RESERVE_BLOCK - 2); iCount++) {
00558 
00559                 XEEBeginWrite(iCount);
00560                 XEEWrite('.');
00561         XEEEndWrite();
00562                 while(XEEIsBusy());
00563     }
00564 
00565 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00566         putrsUART((ROM char*)"All config data has been deleted. \r\n");
00567         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Restarting device.............\r\n");
00568 #endif
00569 
00570 
00571     // perform a Hardware restart
00572         Reset();
00573 
00574 }
00575 
00576 //********************************************************************
00577 /**
00578  Function        SchemaTasks
00579  PreCondition:    None
00580  Side Effects:    None
00581  Overview:
00582  General task manager for any implemented xPL Schema(s)
00583  
00584  \todo add a timer that prevents the xPL task from blocking access to IOTasks();
00585  
00586  @param           None
00587  @result          True if no task has ran
00588 
00589 */
00590 
00591 BOOL SchemaTasks(void) {
00592 
00593         BOOL ReturnResult;
00594         int iCounter, DeviceSelected, CurrentTask;
00595 
00596         // If there are no tasks in queue check to see if the battery state should be checked
00597         if (xPLTaskList.FreePosition == xPLTaskList.CurentTask) {
00598                 if (BatteryCheckTimer < TickGet()) {
00599                         BatteryCheckTimer = TickGet() + TICK_SECOND;
00600                         BatteryTask();
00601                 }
00602         }
00603 
00604 
00605         // Is there a task to work on?
00606         if (xPLTaskList.FreePosition == xPLTaskList.CurentTask) {
00607                 // as there are no messages to be sent, check the IOTasks to see if the state of the zones has changed
00608                 ReturnResult = IOTasks();
00609                 return ReturnResult;  // Returns is a message was sent by the IOTasks
00610                 
00611                 // todo add a timer that prevents the xPL task from blocking access to IOTasks();
00612         }
00613 
00614         // If the current task has not completed make sure it has the chance to run again.
00615         if (xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskList.CurentTask].TaskState == 0) {
00616                 // updates the current Task, remember the current task will end up being the last task processed once this has run
00617                 if (xPLTaskList.CurentTask < (XPLBUFFERSIZE-1))
00618                         xPLTaskList.CurentTask++;
00619                 else if(xPLTaskList.CurentTask >= (XPLBUFFERSIZE-1))
00620                         xPLTaskList.CurentTask =0;
00621         }
00622         CurrentTask = xPLTaskList.CurentTask;   
00623 
00624         // populate IsChangeFlagged from the zone array for the task to be processed
00625         for(iCounter =0; iCounter < ZONECOUNT; iCounter++)
00626                  ZoneConfig[iCounter].IsChangeFlagged = xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskList.CurentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter];
00627 
00628         // populate IsChangeFlagged from the area array for the task to be processed
00629                 for(iCounter =0; iCounter <= AREACOUNT; iCounter++)
00630                         AreaConfig[iCounter].IsChangeFlagged = xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskList.CurentTask].FlaggedAreas[iCounter];
00631 
00632         switch (xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskList.CurentTask].TaskBuffered) {
00633 
00634                 case TB_SendConfigList:
00635                         SendConfigList(); //very simple
00636                         break;
00637 
00638                 case TB_ArmFailed:
00639                         StateChangeToArmFailed(); // needs zones or areas populated
00640                         break;
00641 
00642                 case TB_SendArmed:
00643                         SendArmed(); // extracts data from the zones & area directly
00644                         if(xPLConfig.SMTP_ArmDisarm == TRUE)
00645                                 SMTPQueueEmail (SMTP_Arm); // queue an email notification
00646                         break;
00647 
00648                 case TB_SendDisarm:
00649                         SendDisarm();
00650                         if(xPLConfig.SMTP_ArmDisarm == TRUE)
00651                                 SMTPQueueEmail (SMTP_Disarm);
00652                         break;
00653 
00654                 case TB_Panic:
00655                         SendAlarmingMsg(99);
00656                         SMTPQueueEmail (SMTP_Alarmed);
00657                         break;
00658 
00659                 case TB_SendGatewayInfo:
00660                         SendGatewayInfo();
00661                         break;
00662 
00663                 case TB_SendZoneList:
00664                         SendZoneList();
00665                         break;
00666 
00667                 case TB_SendAreaList:
00668                         SendAreaList();
00669                         break;
00670 
00671                 case TB_SendGateStat:
00672                         SendGateStat();
00673                         break;
00674 
00675                 case TB_SendAreaStat:
00676                         for(iCounter =0; iCounter < AREACOUNT; iCounter++)
00677                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedAreas[iCounter] == 1)
00678                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00679                         SendAreaStat (DeviceSelected);
00680                         break;
00681 
00682                 case TB_SendZoneStat:
00683                         for(iCounter =0; iCounter < ZONECOUNT; iCounter++)
00684                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter] == 1)
00685                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00686                         SendZoneStat (DeviceSelected);
00687                         break;
00688 
00689                 case TB_SendZoneInfo:
00690                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) 
00691                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter] == 1)
00692                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00693                         SendZoneInfo(DeviceSelected);
00694                         break;
00695 
00696                 case TB_SendAreaInfo:
00697                         for(iCounter =0; iCounter < AREACOUNT; iCounter++)
00698                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedAreas[iCounter] == 1)
00699                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00700                         SendAreaInfo(DeviceSelected);
00701                         break;
00702 
00703                 case TB_Isolate:
00704                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) 
00705                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter] == 1)
00706                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00707                         IsolateZone(DeviceSelected);
00708                         break;
00709                         
00710                 case TB_Bypass:
00711                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) 
00712                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter] == 1)
00713                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00714                         bypassZone(DeviceSelected);
00715                         break;
00716                         
00717                 case TB_Enable:
00718                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) 
00719                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter] == 1)
00720                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00721                         EnableZone(DeviceSelected);
00722                         break;
00723 
00724         
00725                 case TB_SendAreaStateMsg:
00726                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) 
00727                                 if (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].FlaggedZones[iCounter] == 1)
00728                                         DeviceSelected = iCounter;
00729                         xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].TaskState = SendAreaStateMsg (xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].NewZoneState, DeviceSelected, xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].TaskState);
00730                         break;
00731 
00732                 case TB_SendInvalidUser:
00733                         SendError( (ROM char *)"user invalid");
00734                         break;
00735 
00736                 case TB_SendInvalidUserTimestamp:
00737                         SendError( (ROM char *)"Timestamp out of range. Check system time");
00738                         break;
00739 
00740                 case TB_SendGatewayChanged:
00741                         SendGatewayChanged();
00742                         xPLTaskList.GatewayChangedTimer = 0;
00743                         break;
00744 
00745                 case TB_SendError:
00746                         SendError(xPLTaskList.Task[CurrentTask].ErrorMessage);
00747                         break;
00748 
00749                 case TB_SendBatteryStat:
00750                         SendBatteryStat();
00751                         break;
00752 
00753                 case TB_SendACStat:
00754                         SendACStat();
00755                         break;
00756 
00757 
00758         } // switch
00759 
00760 
00761         return ReturnResult;
00762 
00763 } //SchemaTasks
00764 
00765 
00766 //********************************************************************
00767 /**
00768  Function        IOTasks
00769  PreCondition:    None
00770  Side Effects:    Zone and Area states, sends UDP
00771  Overview:
00772  This procedure moniters the statis of zones and areas, sending triggers or alarms of a state changes
00773  It also calls the functions that control the current alarm state (alarming / alarmed)
00774 
00775  \todo  when exiting from sending a message need to return to next position. Low task
00776 
00777  @result BOOL, no UDP message sent (false means message sent)
00778 
00779 */
00780 BOOL IOTasks (void) {
00781 
00782         int CheckingZone, xPLTaskID;
00783         Zone_States ZoneResult, PreviousZoneState;
00784 
00785 
00786         //If EntryTimer set and state is Disarmed, clear entry timer
00787         if ((EntryTimer != (unsigned)0) && (AlarmState == Disarmed)) EntryTimer = 0;
00788 
00789         //If entry timer has expired then Change to Alarming and sent ZoneID of the zone that triggered the entry timer
00790         if ((TickGet() > EntryTimer) && (EntryTimer != (unsigned)0) )   {
00791                 StateChangeToAlarming(TriggeredEntryZone);
00792                 return FALSE;
00793         }
00794 
00795         //Loop though all Zones's only when needed to
00796         if (TickGet() > NextZoneCheckDelay) {
00797 
00798                 for (CheckingZone = 0; CheckingZone < ZONECOUNT; CheckingZone++) {
00799 
00800                         // What is the previous state
00801                         if (ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].IsTampered) PreviousZoneState = StateTamper;
00802                         else if (ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].IsTriggered) PreviousZoneState = StateTrigger;
00803                         else PreviousZoneState = StateNormal;
00804 
00805                         // determine the current state
00806                         ZoneResult = IsZoneTriggered(CheckingZone);
00807 
00808                         //If the result is nothing then do nothing
00809                         if (ZoneResult == StateNothing)
00810                                 goto EndLoop;
00811 
00812                         //If returning from Tamper send ZoneState and AreaState messages
00813                         if ((ZoneResult == StateNormal) && (PreviousZoneState ==  StateTamper)){
00814                                 SendZoneStateMsg(StateNormal,CheckingZone);
00815                                 xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStateMsg);
00816                                 xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].NewZoneState = StateNormal;
00817                                 return FALSE;
00818                         }
00819 
00820                         //If Tamper send ZoneState and AreaState messages and sound alarm
00821                         if (ZoneResult == StateTamper) {
00822                                 // set the alarm off when any zone is tampered
00823                                 StateChangeToAlarming(CheckingZone);
00824                                 SendZoneStateMsg(StateTamper,CheckingZone);
00825                                 xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStateMsg); 
00826                                 xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].NewZoneState = StateTamper;
00827                                 return FALSE;
00828                         }
00829 
00830 
00831                         //If returning from triggered send ZoneState and AreaState messages
00832                         if ((ZoneResult == StateNormal) && (PreviousZoneState ==  StateTrigger)){
00833                                 SendZoneStateMsg(StateNormal,CheckingZone);
00834                                 xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStateMsg);
00835                                 xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].NewZoneState = StateNormal; 
00836                                 return FALSE;
00837                         }
00838 
00839                         //If triggered and 24H, set the alarm off
00840                         if ((ZoneResult == StateTrigger) && (ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].ZoneType == TwentyFourHour)) {
00841                                 StateChangeToAlarming(CheckingZone);
00842                                 return FALSE;
00843                         }
00844 
00845                         //If Triggered and not Armed send trigger message
00846                         if ((ZoneResult == StateTrigger) && (!ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].IsArmed)) {
00847                                 SendZoneStateMsg(StateTrigger,CheckingZone);
00848                                 xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStateMsg);
00849                                 xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].NewZoneState = StateTrigger;
00850                                 return FALSE;
00851                         }
00852 
00853 
00854                         //If Triggered and Zone is Armed
00855                         if ((ZoneResult == StateTrigger) && (ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].IsArmed)) {
00856                                 // If the zone is an entry point and Exit time is not Zero, set (Triggered Entery Zone) = ZoneID and send trigger messages
00857                                 if ((ExitTimer != (unsigned)0) && (ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].IsEntry)) {
00858                                         SendZoneStateMsg (StateTrigger,CheckingZone);
00859                                         xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStateMsg);
00860                                         xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].NewZoneState = StateTamper;
00861                                         return FALSE;
00862                                 }
00863                                 //If the zone is an entry point and the Entry timer is not set, then set it and send trigger messages
00864                                 if ((EntryTimer == (unsigned)0) && (ZoneConfig[CheckingZone].IsEntry)) {
00865                                         EntryTimer = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.EntryDelay);
00866                                         TriggeredEntryZone = CheckingZone;
00867                                         SendZoneStateMsg (StateTrigger,CheckingZone);
00868                                         xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStateMsg);
00869                                         xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].NewZoneState = StateTrigger;
00870                                         return FALSE;
00871                                 }
00872                                 //Now we set the alarm off
00873                                 StateChangeToAlarming(CheckingZone);
00874                                 return FALSE;
00875                         }
00876                 EndLoop:
00877 
00878                         TRUE; // what a funny little hack ;)
00879 
00880                 }//Loop ends here
00881 
00882 
00883 
00884                 // Set the time of the next zone check
00885                 NextZoneCheckDelay = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND / ZONECHECKDELAY);
00886 
00887 
00888         } // end of delay
00889 
00890         //If Exit timer active and time passed, then set it to zero.
00891         if ((ExitTimer !=(unsigned)0) && (TickGet() > ExitTimer)) ExitTimer = 0;
00892 
00893 
00894         //If in alarming state, call the alarmed task manager
00895         if ((AlarmState == Alarming) || ( AlarmState == Alarming24))  TaskAlarming();
00896 
00897         //If in alarmed state call the alarmed task
00898         if ((AlarmState == Alarmed) || ( AlarmState == Alarmed24))  TaskAlarmed();
00899 
00900         return TRUE;
00901 
00902 } //IOTasks
00903 
00904 
00905 //********************************************************************
00906 /**
00907  
00908  Used to change the alarm state, sends out required messages and chages
00909  any IO lines such as siren and strobe
00910  
00911  @param           ZoneID
00912  @result          IO changes
00913 
00914 */
00915 
00916 void StateChangeToAlarming (int ZoneID) {
00917 
00918         int AreaCount;
00919 
00920         // Tell the dubugger
00921 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00922         putrsUART((ROM char*)"State change to alarming\r\n");
00923 #endif
00924 
00925         //Ensure entry and exit timers are cleared
00926         EntryTimer = 0;
00927         ExitTimer = 0;
00928 
00929 
00930         // Start the strobe and internal siren
00931         if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].ZoneType != Silent) {
00932                 STROBE_IO = 1;
00933                 INT_SIREN_IO = 1;
00934         }
00935 
00936         // update the zone state
00937         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].IsAlarmed = TRUE;
00938         ZoneConfig[ZoneID].State = StateAlarm;
00939         
00940         // Update the area state
00941         for (AreaCount = 0; AreaCount < AREACOUNT; AreaCount++) {
00942                 if (isZoneMemberOfArea(ZoneID, AreaCount) == TRUE)
00943                         AreaConfig[AreaCount].IsAlarmed = TRUE;
00944                         
00945                         // if area is not isolted or bypassed
00946                         if ((AreaConfig[AreaCount].State != StateBypass) && (AreaConfig[AreaCount].State != StateIsolate)) 
00947                                 AreaConfig[AreaCount].State = StateAlarm;       
00948         }
00949 
00950         //Queue email
00951         LastZoneAlarmed = ZoneID;
00952         if (xPLConfig.SMTP_OnlyInitalAlarm == FALSE)
00953                 SMTPQueueEmail (SMTP_Alarmed);
00954 
00955         // Dont want to reset the alarm timers each time something is triggered
00956         if ((AlarmState !=Alarming24) &&  (AlarmState !=Alarming))  {
00957 
00958                 //Queue email email
00959                 if (xPLConfig.SMTP_OnlyInitalAlarm == TRUE)
00960                         SMTPQueueEmail (SMTP_Alarmed);
00961 
00962                 if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].ZoneType != TwentyFourHour) {
00963                         AlarmState = Alarming;//Change the current state to alarming
00964                         SirenTimer = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.SirenDelay); //check to see if external siren should be activated
00965                         AlarmingTimer =  TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.AlarmingDuration);
00966                 }
00967                 else {
00968                         AlarmState = Alarming24; //Change the current state to alarming
00969                         SirenTimer = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.SirenDelay24h);
00970                         AlarmingTimer =  TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.Alarming24Duration);
00971                 }
00972         } // !=Alarming
00973 
00974         // If the zone type is silent then do not allow the siren timer
00975         if (ZoneConfig[ZoneID].ZoneType == Silent)
00976                 SirenTimer = 0;
00977 
00978         // Send the alarming message
00979         SendAlarmingMsg(ZoneID);
00980 
00981 }
00982 //********************************************************************
00983 /**
00984  Function        StateChangeToAlarmed
00985  PreCondition:    None
00986  Side Effects:    None
00987  Overview:
00988  Used to change the alarmed state
00989  @param           None
00990  @result          IO changes
00991 
00992 */
00993 void StateChangeToAlarmed (void) {
00994 
00995         // Tell the debugger
00996 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00997         putrsUART((ROM char*)"State changed to Alarmed, siren and strobe off\r\n");
00998 #endif
00999 
01000         //Clear timers
01001         AlarmingTimer = 0;
01002         SirenTimer = 0;
01003 
01004         //Stop sirens
01005         EXT_SIREN_IO = 0;
01006         INT_SIREN_IO = 0;
01007 
01008         //Change internal state to alarmed
01009         if (AlarmState == Alarming24) AlarmState = Alarmed24;
01010         if (AlarmState == Alarming) AlarmState = Alarmed;
01011 
01012 }
01013 //********************************************************************
01014 /**
01015  Function        TaskAlarming
01016  PreCondition:    None
01017  Side Effects:    None
01018  Overview:
01019  Used to change the IO outputs while in the alarming state
01020  @param           None
01021  @result          IO changes
01022 
01023 */
01024 
01025 void TaskAlarming (void) {
01026 
01027         static int DebugTimer; // Only prints updates on new second
01028         int SecondsLeft;
01029         char DebugOut[6];
01030 
01031         // Time delay before activating the external siren
01032         if ((SirenTimer != (unsigned) 0) && (TickGet() > SirenTimer))  SirenTimer = 0;
01033 
01034         //Set sirens
01035         if (SirenTimer == (unsigned) 0) {
01036                 EXT_SIREN_IO = 1;
01037                 INT_SIREN_IO = 1;
01038         }
01039 
01040         // has the siren gone on for long enough?
01041         if (TickGet() > AlarmingTimer) {
01042                 StateChangeToAlarmed();
01043                 DebugTimer = 0;
01044                 AlarmingTimer = 0;
01045         }
01046 
01047         // Debug output
01048 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01049         SecondsLeft = (AlarmingTimer - TickGet()) / TICK_SECOND;
01050         if (DebugTimer != SecondsLeft) {
01051                 DebugTimer = SecondsLeft;
01052 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01053                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Alarming count down: ");
01054                 uitoa(DebugTimer,  DebugOut);
01055                 putsUART(DebugOut);
01056                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01057 #endif
01058         }
01059 #endif
01060 
01061 
01062 }
01063 //********************************************************************
01064 /**
01065  Function        TaskAlarmed
01066  PreCondition:    None
01067  Side Effects:    None
01068  Overview:
01069  Used to change the IO outputs while in the alarmed state
01070  @param           None
01071  @result          IO changes
01072 
01073 */
01074 void TaskAlarmed (void) {
01075 
01076         //nothing to do here
01077 
01078 
01079 }
01080 //********************************************************************
01081 /**
01082  Function        ClearArmingFlags
01083  PreCondition:    None
01084  Side Effects:    Arming flags
01085  Overview:
01086  utility used to remove all of the arming flags
01087  @param           None
01088  @result          None
01089 
01090 */
01091 void ClearArmingFlags (void) {
01092 
01093         //Cycle through all zones and clear arming flags
01094         for (iCount =0; iCount > ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01095                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
01096 
01097         }
01098 
01099 
01100         //Cycle through all areas and clear arming flags
01101         for (iCount =0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
01102                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
01103 
01104         }
01105 
01106 
01107 }

01110 //********************************************************************
01111 /**
01112  Function        Arm
01113  PreCondition:    Arming flags must be set
01114  Side Effects:    Arm device
01115  Overview:
01116  Changes that alarm state to Arm based on the arming flags
01117 
01118  @param           exit delay
01119  @result          None
01120 */
01121 
01122 void Arm (int short TimeDelay) {
01123         int Counter;
01124 
01125 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01126         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Arm\r\n");
01127 #endif
01128 
01129         // Check for a zone list or area list, if missing send error with description of fault
01130         for (iCount = 0, i2Count = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
01131                 if (AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged == TRUE)
01132                         i2Count++;
01133         } //for
01134 
01135         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01136                 if (ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged == TRUE)
01137                         i2Count++;
01138         } //for
01139 
01140         if (i2Count == 0) {
01141                 i2Count = addxPLMessage (TB_SendError);
01142                 xPLTaskList.Task[i2Count].ErrorMessage = "Nothing selected to arm";
01143         }
01144         else
01145                 ExitTimer = TickGet() + (TimeDelay * TICK_SECOND);
01146         StateChangeToArm (FALSE);
01147 
01148 } // Arm
01149 
01150 //********************************************************************
01151 /**
01152  Function        ArmHome
01153  PreCondition:    None
01154  Side Effects:    Arm device
01155  Overview:
01156  Changes that alarm state to Arm Home
01157  @param           exit delay
01158  @result          None
01159 
01160 */
01161 
01162 void ArmHome (int short TimeDelay) {
01163 
01164 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01165         putrsUART((ROM char*)"ArmHome\r\n");
01166 #endif
01167 
01168         // Set arming flags on all zones of type perimeter
01169         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01170                 if (ZoneConfig[iCount].ZoneType == Perimiter) ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
01171                 if (ZoneConfig[iCount].ZoneType == Interior) ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
01172         }
01173 
01174         ExitTimer = TickGet() + (TimeDelay * TICK_SECOND);
01175         StateChangeToArm(FALSE);
01176 
01177 } // ArmHome
01178

01238 //********************************************************************
01239 /**
01240  Function        Panic
01241  PreCondition:    None
01242  Side Effects:    IO lines and state
01243  Overview:
01244  Buts the alarm into the panic state and sends xPL message
01245  @param           None
01246  @result          None
01247 
01248 */
01249 void Panic (void) {
01250 
01251 
01252 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01253         putrsUART((ROM char*)"PANIC\r\n");
01254 #endif
01255 
01256         // set off the alarm
01257         //Ensure entry and exit timers are cleared
01258         EntryTimer = 0;
01259         ExitTimer = 0;
01260 
01261         // Start the strobe and internal siren
01262         STROBE_IO = 1;
01263         INT_SIREN_IO = 1;
01264         AlarmState = Alarming;
01265         SirenTimer = TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.SirenDelay); //check to see if external siren should be activated
01266         AlarmingTimer =  TickGet() + (TICK_SECOND * xPLConfig.AlarmingDuration);
01267 
01268         // Send the alarming message
01269         
01270         addxPLMessage(TB_Panic);
01271 } // Panic
01272 
01273 /********************************************************************
01274  *********************************************************************
01275  In response to message
01276  *********************************************************************
01277  ********************************************************************/
01278 
01279 
01280 
01281 //********************************************************************
01282 /**
01283  Function        StateChangeToArm
01284  PreCondition:    ExitTimer must be set
01285  Side Effects:    Changes Armed / arming flags and state
01286  Overview:
01287  Perform a test on all zones to ensure it is in a good state to be armed.
01288  If not it will generate an xPL error message.
01289  Converts all of the arming flags into Armed flags, then clears arming flags
01290  and sends the armed message
01291 
01292  @param           None
01293  @result          None
01294 
01295 */
01296 void StateChangeToArm (BOOL isLatchKey) {
01297 
01298         BOOL isAllZonesArmed, OneOrMoreZones, ArmFailed;
01299         int Counter, TaskNumber, ZoneCounter;
01300 
01301 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01302         putrsUART((ROM char*)"State change to arm called\r\n");
01303 #endif
01304 
01305         // determine if an arming zone is triggered, if so cancel the action
01306         ArmFailed = FALSE;
01307         for (Counter=0;Counter <= ZONECOUNT;Counter++) {
01308                 if (ArmingZoneState(Counter) != StateNormal) {  // add entry & exit zones here
01309                         // The test has failed
01310                         if (ArmFailed == FALSE) {
01311                                 // This is the first failed zone
01312                                 TaskNumber = addxPLMessage (TB_ArmFailed); // create the task
01313                                 for (ZoneCounter=0;ZoneCounter <= ZONECOUNT; ZoneCounter++) // clear out the zone list
01314                                         xPLTaskList.Task[TaskNumber].FlaggedZones[ZoneCounter] = 0;
01315                                 ArmFailed = TRUE;
01316                         }
01317                         // flag this zone as errored
01318                         xPLTaskList.Task[TaskNumber].FlaggedZones[Counter] = 1;         
01319                         }
01320         }
01321 
01322 
01323         if (ArmFailed) { 
01324         #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01325                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"Arm failed as a zone is incorrect\r\n");
01326         #endif
01327                 goto Exit_Here; // do not arm the system
01328         }
01329                         
01330                         
01331 
01332         //Cycle through all of the zones
01333         for (iCount =0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01334 
01335                 //skip the bypassed or disabled. Arm anything that has the arming flag
01336                 if ((!ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated) && (!ZoneConfig[iCount].IsBypassed))
01337                 {
01338                         if(ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged) ZoneConfig[iCount].IsArmed = TRUE;
01339                 }
01340         }// for loop
01341 
01342 
01343         // cycle though the area's, if all the zones in an area are armed, make the area armed as well
01344         for (iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
01345                 if ( (!AreaConfig[iCount].IsIsolated) && (!AreaConfig[iCount].IsBypassed) ) {
01346 
01347                         isAllZonesArmed = TRUE;
01348                         OneOrMoreZones = FALSE;
01349                         for (i2Count = 0; i2Count < ZONECOUNT; i2Count++) {
01350                                 //is this zone a member?
01351                                 if (isZoneMemberOfArea(iCount, i2Count) == TRUE) {
01352                                         // ensure it is not disable before arming
01353                                         if ((!ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsIsolated) && (!ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsBypassed)) {
01354                                                 if (ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsArmed == TRUE) {
01355                                                         ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsArmed = TRUE;
01356                                                         OneOrMoreZones = TRUE;
01357                                                 }
01358                                                 else isAllZonesArmed = FALSE;
01359                                         } // Zone not isolated or bypassed
01360                                 }// IsMemberofArea
01361 
01362                         } // for i2Count
01363 
01364                         if (OneOrMoreZones && isAllZonesArmed)
01365                                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
01366 
01367                 }// IsChangeFlagged
01368         }// for iCount
01369 
01370 
01371 
01372         //Cycle through all areas, if one is arming enable all zones in the area
01373         for (iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
01374                 if ((AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged) && ((!AreaConfig[iCount].IsIsolated) && (!AreaConfig[iCount].IsBypassed)) ) {
01375 
01376                         for (i2Count = 0; i2Count < ZONECOUNT; i2Count++) {
01377                                 //is this zone a member?
01378                                 if (isZoneMemberOfArea(iCount, i2Count) == TRUE) {
01379                                         // ensure it is not disable before arming
01380                                         if ((!ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsIsolated) && (!ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsBypassed)) ZoneConfig[i2Count].IsArmed = TRUE;
01381                                 }// IsMemberofArea
01382 
01383                         } // for i2Count
01384                 }// IsChangeFlagged
01385         }// for iCount
01386 
01387         // Change the state
01388         if (isLatchKey) AlarmState = Armed_LatchKey;
01389         else AlarmState = Armed;
01390 
01391         // sends message and clears flags
01392         addxPLMessage(TB_SendArmed);
01393 
01394 Exit_Here:
01395         // Greetings human
01396         Counter = 0;
01397 }
01398 
01399 //********************************************************************
01400 /**
01401  Function        StateChangeToArmFailed
01402  PreCondition:    None
01403  Side Effects:    Changes arming flags
01404  Overview:
01405  This is called when a Arming (any type) action fails.  It will clear the arming flags
01406  @param           None
01407  @result          None
01408 
01409 */
01410 
01411 void StateChangeToArmFailed (void) {
01412 
01413         BOOL FirstZone = TRUE;
01414 
01415 
01416 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01417         putrsUART((ROM char*)"State change to arm failed\r\n");
01418 #endif
01419 
01420 
01421         //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
01422         if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
01423 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01424                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# ArmFailed, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
01425 #endif
01426         }
01427         else {
01428 
01429                 //Generate xPL head with type security.gateway
01430                 XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Gateway);
01431                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "event=error\nzone-list=");
01432 
01433                 //Scan all zones, list those that are triggered and of status arming
01434                 for (iCount =0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01435                         if ((ZoneConfig[iCount].IsTriggered) && (ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged))
01436                         {
01437                                 if (FirstZone == FALSE) UDPPut(',');
01438                                 itoa(iCount, xPLMsgKey);
01439                                 UDPPutArray(xPLMsgKey,strlen(xPLMsgKey));
01440                                 FirstZone = FALSE;
01441                         }
01442                 }
01443 
01444                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\nerror=Arm fail as zone tripped");
01445                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\n}\n");
01446                 // Now transmit it.
01447                 UDPFlush();
01448         }
01449 
01450 
01451 }
01452 
01453 
01454 
01455 //********************************************************************
01456 /**
01457  Function        isZoneMemberOfArea
01458  PreCondition:    None
01459  Side Effects:
01460  Overview:
01461  Returns true of false is an Zone is a member to an area
01462  @param           Zone ID, Area ID
01463  @result          BOOL
01464 
01465 */
01466 
01467 BOOL isZoneMemberOfArea(int TheZone, int TheArea) {
01468 
01469         unsigned short int Result;
01470 
01471 #if (AREACOUNT > 8)
01472 #error Having more then 8 areas is not possible under this design.
01473 #endif
01474 
01475         if (TheArea == 0) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b00000001);
01476         if (TheArea == 1) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b00000010);
01477         if (TheArea == 2) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b00000100);
01478         if (TheArea == 3) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b00001000);
01479         if (TheArea == 4) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b00010000);
01480         if (TheArea == 5) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b00100000);
01481         if (TheArea == 6) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b01000000);
01482         if (TheArea == 7) Result = (ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList & 0b10000000);
01483 
01484         /*
01485          #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01486          putrsUART((ROM char*)"Is Area Triggered, Area = ");
01487          putcUART((char) '0' + TheArea);
01488 
01489          putrsUART((ROM char*)" Zone = ");
01490          uitoa(TheZone, xPLMsgKey);
01491          putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
01492 
01493          putrsUART((ROM char*)" AreaList = ");
01494          uitoa(ZoneConfig[TheZone].AreaList, xPLMsgKey);
01495          putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
01496 
01497          putrsUART((ROM char*)" Result = ");
01498          uitoa(Result, xPLMsgKey);
01499          putsUART(xPLMsgKey);
01500 
01501          putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01502          #endif
01503          */
01504         if (Result >= 1)  return TRUE;
01505         else return FALSE;
01506 
01507 
01508 }//isZoneMemberOfArea
01509 
01510 //********************************************************************
01511 /**
01512  Function        SetArmingArea
01513  PreCondition:    None
01514  Side Effects:    Sets arming flags for areas
01515  Overview:
01516  Sets the arming flags for the area based on values in the KVP
01517  @param           Value from xPL message
01518  @result          None
01519 
01520 */
01521 void SetArmingArea(char * TheValue) {
01522 
01523 
01524 
01525 }
01526 //********************************************************************
01527 /**
01528  Function        SetArmingZone
01529  PreCondition:    None
01530  Side Effects:    Sets arming flags for zones
01531  Overview:
01532  Sets the arming flags for the zones based on values in the KVP
01533 
01534  @param           Value from xPL message, BOOL is zone - False is Area
01535  @result          None
01536 */
01537 void SetArming(char * TheValue, BOOL isZone) {
01538 
01539         int DeviceID;
01540         char TempBuffer[3];
01541 
01542 
01543         //if 'all' then set all zones to arming
01544         if (strncmppgm2ram(TheValue,"all",3)) {
01545                 if (isZone) {
01546                         // Loop though all of the zones
01547                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01548                                 if ((!ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated) && (!ZoneConfig[iCount].IsBypassed)) {
01549                                         ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
01550                                 }
01551                         } // for
01552                 } // isZone
01553                 else {
01554                         // Loop though all of the Area's
01555                         for (iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
01556                                 if ((!AreaConfig[iCount].IsIsolated) && (!AreaConfig[iCount].IsBypassed)) {
01557                                         AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
01558                                 }
01559                         } // for
01560                 }// !isZone
01561         }// if (all)
01562         else {
01563 
01564                 // looking for digits seperated by a commar and terminated by new line eg (01, 02 ,3,4,12\n)
01565                 memset(TempBuffer,'\0', 3);
01566                 for (iCount = 0, i2Count =0;iCount < xPLMSGVALUELENGTH; iCount++) {
01567                         if (TheValue[iCount] == ' ') //ignore spaces
01568                                 if ((i2Count ==0) && (TheValue[iCount] == '0')) //ignore leading zeros
01569                                         if ((TheValue[iCount] == ',') || (TheValue[iCount] == '\n')) {
01570                                                 //make sure we have data first
01571                                                 if (!i2Count == 0) {
01572                                                         DeviceID = atoi(TempBuffer);
01573                                                         // ensure that the zone is valid, if so arm it
01574                                                         if (isZone) {
01575                                                                 if ((DeviceID < ZONECOUNT) && (DeviceID != 0)) ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
01576                                                         }
01577                                                         if (!isZone) {
01578                                                                 if ((DeviceID < AREACOUNT) && (DeviceID != 0)) AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = TRUE;
01579                                                         }
01580                                                         if (TheValue[iCount] == '\n') break; // signals the end of the line
01581                                                         memset(TempBuffer,'\0', 3);
01582                                                 }//(!i2Count == 0)
01583                                         }// ((TheValue[iCount] == ',') || (TheValue[iCount] == '\n'))
01584                                         else {
01585                                                 TempBuffer[i2Count] = TheValue[iCount];
01586                                                 i2Count++;
01587                                         }
01588 
01589                 }// for
01590 
01591         } // else
01592 
01593 } // SetArmingZone
01594 
01595 
01596 //********************************************************************
01597 /**
01598  Function        ArmingZoneState
01599  PreCondition:    Arming flags set
01600  Side Effects:
01601  Overview:
01602  StateNormal means everything is ok and the zone is in a good state for arming.
01603  @param           The zone to be checked
01604  @result          Zone_States, state of the zone
01605 
01606 */
01607 Zone_States ArmingZoneState (int TheZone) {
01608 
01609         // zone is not marked as arming
01610         if (!ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsChangeFlagged)
01611                 return StateNormal;
01612         // isolated or bypassed
01613         if ((ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsBypassed) || (ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsIsolated))
01614                 return StateNormal;
01615         // Triggered zone is not an entry point
01616         if ((ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsTriggered) && (!ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsEntry))
01617                 return StateTrigger;
01618         // Anything that is tampered is a no no
01619         if (ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsTampered)
01620                 return StateTamper;
01621 
01622         // If we get this far then all is good.
01623         return StateNormal;
01624 }
01625 
01626 //********************************************************************
01627 /**
01628  Function        SchemaProcessUDPMsg
01629  PreCondition:    None
01630  Side Effects:    Changes Armed / arming flags
01631  Overview:
01632  Called by xPL.c when ever a message is received. Here we determine what actions are
01633  needed in response to a message.
01634 
01635  When changing the alarm state when there is no delay the arming timer is set to an expired value.
01636  This means the state change will not occur until the next task run occurs.
01637  @param           Delay
01638  @result          None
01639 
01640 
01641 */
01642 void SchemaProcessUDPMsg (void) {
01643 
01644         int short TimeDelay = xPLConfig.ExitDelay;
01645         int TheMessageType, xPLTaskID;
01646 
01647         BOOL MessageIsCommand = FALSE;
01648         BOOL MessageIsRequest = FALSE;
01649 
01650         // Ensure the message is directed to me and its of the security class
01651         if ((xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination == To_Me ) && (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaClass == Class_Security))  {
01652 
01653                 // clear out any left over flags
01654                 ClearArmingFlags();
01655                 memset(UserID,'\0',USERNAMELENGTH);
01656 
01657                 // We have to process all of the message before we can act on it as the message could be out of order. Open standards are not always standard
01658                 while (SaveKVP(xPLMsgKey,xPLMsgValue )) {
01659 
01660                         if (memcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, "user", 4)) {
01661                                 if (!xPLAuthenticate(xPLMsgValue))
01662                                         return;
01663                         }
01664                         if (memcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM void*)"area-list",9)) SetArming(xPLMsgValue, FALSE);
01665                         if (memcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM void*)"zone-list",9)) SetArming(xPLMsgValue, TRUE);
01666                         if (memcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM void*)"delay",5))  {
01667                                 // Process delay value. If we receive text its might be the word 'default', either way we use the default value.
01668                                 if( isdigit((unsigned char)xPLMsgValue[0] ) ==0 )
01669                                         TimeDelay = xPLConfig.ExitDelay;
01670                                 else
01671                                         TimeDelay = atoi(xPLMsgValue);
01672                         }
01673 
01674                         if (memcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, "command",7)) {
01675                                 if (!xPLFindArrayInKVP(SecurityCommandText, 8, &TheMessageType, xPLMsgValue)) {
01676 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01677                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"#Note# command type not known\r\n");
01678 #endif
01679                                 }
01680                                 else MessageIsCommand = TRUE;
01681                         }
01682                         if (memcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, "request",7)) {
01683                                 if (!xPLFindArrayInKVP(SecurityRequestsText, 8, &TheMessageType, xPLMsgValue)) {
01684 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01685                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"#Note# request type not known\r\n");
01686 #endif
01687                                 }
01688                                 else MessageIsRequest = TRUE;
01689                         }
01690 
01691                 } // while
01692 
01693 
01694                 // ### Message Type BASIC
01695 
01696                 if (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Basic) {
01697 
01698                         if (MessageIsCommand) {
01699 
01700                                 switch (TheMessageType) {
01701 
01702                                         case Command_arm: // Arm, needs area list or zone list
01703                                                 Arm(TimeDelay);
01704                                                 break;
01705 
01706                                         case Command_armhome:
01707                                                 ArmHome(TimeDelay);
01708                                                 break;
01709 
01710                                         case Command_armaway:
01711                                                 ArmAway (TimeDelay);
01712                                                 break;
01713 
01714                                         case Command_armlatchkey:
01715                                                 ArmLatchkey (TimeDelay);
01716                                                 break;
01717 
01718                                         case Command_disarm:
01719                                                 // call Disarm and pass the userID
01720                                                 Disarm();
01721                                                 break;
01722 
01723                                         case Command_panic:
01724                                                 Panic();
01725                                                 break;
01726 
01727                                         case Command_isolate:
01728                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Isolate) ;
01729                                                 break;
01730 
01731                                         case Command_bypass:
01732                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Bypass) ;
01733                                                 break;
01734 
01735                                         case Command_enable:
01736                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_Enable) ;
01737                                                 break;
01738 
01739 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01740                                         default:
01741                                                 // Something has gone wrong!
01742                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# Shit, something broke with Type_Basic when the message was received\r\n");
01743 #endif
01744 
01745 
01746                                 } // switch (TheMessageType)
01747                         } // MessageIsCommand
01748 
01749                 } // xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Basic
01750 
01751 
01752                 // ### Message Type REQUEST
01753 
01754                 if (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Request) {
01755 
01756                         if (MessageIsRequest) {
01757                                 switch (TheMessageType) {
01758 
01759                                         case Request_gateinfo:
01760                                                 // Send gateway infomation
01761                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendGatewayInfo) ;
01762                                                 break;
01763 
01764                                         case Request_zonelist:
01765                                                 // Send zone list
01766                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendZoneList) ;
01767                                                 break;
01768 
01769                                         case Request_arealist:
01770                                                 // Send area list
01771                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaList );
01772                                                 break;
01773 
01774                                         case Request_zoneinfo:
01775                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendZoneInfo );
01776                                                 break;
01777 
01778                                         case Request_areainfo:
01779                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaInfo );
01780                                                 break;
01781 
01782                                         case Request_gatestat:
01783                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendGateStat);
01784                                                 break;
01785 
01786                                         case Request_zonestat:
01787                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendZoneStat);
01788                                                 break;
01789                 
01790                                         case Request_areastat:
01791                                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendAreaStat);
01792                                                 break;
01793 
01794 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01795                                                 default:
01796                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# Shit broken with Type_Request when msg rc'd\r\n");
01797 #endif
01798 
01799 
01800                                 } //switch (TheMessageType)
01801                         }// MessageIsRequest
01802                 } // xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Request
01803 
01804 
01805         } // To_Me && Class_Security
01806 
01807 
01808 
01809         // #### Device Configuration ###
01810 
01811         if ((xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination == To_Me ) && (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaClass == Class_Config))  {
01812 
01813                 if(AlarmState != Disarmed) {
01814                         //      Note: do not allowing config changes when not in the disarmed state. A restart would make the system disarmed and or remove
01815                         //      parts of the alarm which would be a security risk.
01816                         xPLTaskID = addxPLMessage (TB_SendError);
01817                         xPLTaskList.Task[xPLTaskID].ErrorMessage = "Must be disarmed to update config";
01818                 }
01819                 else {
01820 
01821                         if (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_List) 
01822                                 addxPLMessage(TB_SendConfigList);
01823                                 
01824                         if (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Current) 
01825                                 addxPLMessage (TB_SendConfigCurrent);
01826                         
01827                         if (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Response) {
01828                                 while (SaveKVP(xPLMsgKey,xPLMsgValue )) {
01829 
01830                                         // Device name
01831                                         if (stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM char*) "newconf") ==0) {
01832 
01833                                                 for (iCount =0; xPLMsgValue[iCount] != '\0' && iCount < sizeof(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID); iCount++) {
01834                                                         if(xPLMsgValue[iCount] >= 'A' && xPLMsgValue[iCount] <= 'Z')
01835                                                                 xPLMsgValue[iCount] -= 'A' - 'a'; //Convert to lower case
01836                                                         if((xPLMsgValue[iCount] > 'z') || (xPLMsgValue[iCount] < '0'))  xPLMsgValue[iCount]  = 0;
01837                                                 }
01838 
01839                                                 if (xPLMsgValue[0] != '\0') {
01840                                                         strcpy( xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID, xPLMsgValue);
01841                                                         xPLSaveEEConfig(&xPLConfig, EEDATASTART_XPL, sizeof(xPLConfig));
01842                                                 }
01843 
01844 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01845                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"newconf =");
01846                                                 putsUART(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID);
01847                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01848 #endif
01849 
01850 
01851                                         }
01852                                         if (stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM char*) "interval") ==0) {
01853 
01854                                                 if(atoi(xPLMsgValue) > 1 )  {
01855                                                         xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval = atoi(xPLMsgValue);
01856                                                         xPLSaveEEConfig(&xPLConfig, EEDATASTART_XPL, sizeof(xPLConfig));
01857                                                 }
01858 
01859 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01860                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"interval =");
01861                                                 putcUART( '0' + xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval );
01862                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01863 #endif
01864 
01865 
01866 
01867                                         }
01868                                         if (stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM char*) "ip") ==0) {
01869 
01870                                                 if(StringToIPAddress(xPLMsgValue, &(AppConfig.MyIPAddr))) {
01871                                                         memcpy((void*)&(AppConfig.DefaultIPAddr), (void*)&(AppConfig.MyIPAddr), sizeof(IP_ADDR));
01872 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01873                                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"ip:");
01874                                                         DisplayIPValue(AppConfig.MyIPAddr);
01875                                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01876 #endif
01877 
01878                                                         xPLSaveEEConfig(&AppConfig, EEDATASTART_CONFIG, sizeof(AppConfig));
01879                                                 }
01880                                                 else {
01881                                                         //
01882 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01883                                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"ip errored\r\n");
01884 #endif
01885                                                 }
01886 
01887                                         } //ip
01888                                         if (stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, ( ROM char *)"subnet") ==0)  {
01889                                                 if(StringToIPAddress(xPLMsgValue, &(AppConfig.MyMask))) {
01890                                                         memcpy((void*)&(AppConfig.DefaultMask), (void*)&(AppConfig.MyMask), sizeof(IP_ADDR));
01891 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01892                                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Subnet:");
01893                                                         DisplayIPValue(AppConfig.MyMask);
01894                                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01895 #endif
01896 
01897                                                         xPLSaveEEConfig(&AppConfig, EEDATASTART_CONFIG, sizeof(AppConfig));
01898                                                 }
01899                                                 else {
01900                                                         //
01901 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01902                                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Subnet errored\r\n");
01903 #endif
01904                                                 }
01905                                         }
01906                                 } // while
01907 
01908 
01909 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01910                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n\r\n Restart ##############");
01911 #endif
01912 
01913                                 Reset();
01914                         } //AlarmState != Disarmed
01915                 }// if ((xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination == To_Me ) && (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaClass == Class_Config))
01916 
01917 
01918 
01919         }// Config
01920 
01921 
01922 } // SchemaProcessUDPMsg
01923 
01924 
01925 
01926 //********************************************************************
01927 /**
01928  Function        Disarm
01929  PreCondition:    UserID must be populated first from Authenticate.c
01930  Side Effects:    armed flags, state and IO
01931  Overview:
01932  Disarm the alarm.  Uses the UserID to determine who the user was
01933  @param           None
01934  @result          None
01935 
01936 */
01937 
01938 void Disarm (void) {
01939 
01940 
01941         //Ensure entry and exit timers are cleared
01942         EntryTimer = 0;
01943         ExitTimer = 0;
01944 
01945         //Change any of the IO lines for sirens and strobe
01946         STROBE_IO = 0;
01947         INT_SIREN_IO = 0;
01948         EXT_SIREN_IO = 0;
01949 
01950         //Change the state to disarmed
01951         PreviousAlarmState = Disarmed;
01952 
01953         //set the previous state to disarmed as well
01954         AlarmState = Disarmed;
01955 
01956         //Cycle though all of the zones clear any  Armed, Alarmed, Arming, isolated flags
01957         for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
01958                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE;
01959                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsArmed = FALSE;
01960                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
01961                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
01962         }// for iCount
01963 
01964 
01965         //cycle thought all areas clear any Armed, Alarmed, isolated flags
01966         for (iCount = 0; iCount < AREACOUNT; iCount++) {
01967                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE;
01968                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsArmed = FALSE;
01969                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
01970                 AreaConfig[iCount].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
01971         }// for iCount
01972 
01973 
01974         //Send disarmed message
01975         addxPLMessage (TB_SendDisarm);
01976 
01977 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01978         putrsUART((ROM char*)"State change to disarm\r\n");
01979 #endif
01980 
01981 
01982 } // Disarm
01983 //********************************************************************
01984 /**
01985  Function        IsolateZone
01986  PreCondition:    None

01989  will set the isolated flag for the zone provided
01990  @param           Zone ID
01991  @result          None
01992 
01993 */

01995 void IsolateZone (int TheZone) {
01996 
01997 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01998         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Isolating zone\r\n");
01999 #endif
02000 
02001 
02002         //Set the zone's isolated flag to true
02003         ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsIsolated = TRUE;
02004         ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
02005 
02006         // clear out the status flags
02007         ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsTampered = FALSE;
02008         ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsTriggered = FALSE;
02009         ZoneConfig[TheZone].BounceDelay = 0;
02010         ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
02011 
02012         //Send message
02013 
02014         //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
02015         if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
02016 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02017                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# IsolateZone, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
02018 #endif
02019         }
02020         else {
02021 
02022                 // Generate xPL head with type security.zone
02023                 XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Zone);
02024                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "event=isolated\nzone=");
02025                 itoa(TheZone, xPLMsgKey);
02026                 UDPPutArray(xPLMsgKey,strlen(xPLMsgKey));
02027                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\nstate=true\n}\n");
02028                 UDPFlush();
02029         }//UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)
02030 
02031         //now save the changes
02032         xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));
02033 
02034 } // IsolateZone

02058         AreaConfig[TheArea].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;

02062         AreaConfig[TheArea].IsTampered = FALSE;
02063         AreaConfig[TheArea].IsTriggered = FALSE;
02064         AreaConfig[TheArea].IsAlarmed = FALSE;
02065 
02066         //Send message
02067 
02068         //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
02069         if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
02070 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02071                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# IsolateArea, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
02072 #endif

02075
