02077                 XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Area);
02078                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "area=");

02081                 UDPFlush();

02085         for (iCount = 0; iCount <= ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
02086                 if (isZoneMemberOfArea(iCount, TheArea)) {
02087                         ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = TRUE;
02088                 }// ZoneConfig
02089         }// for iCount
02090 
02091         //now save the changes

02093         xPLSaveEEConfig(AreaConfig, EEDATASTART_AREA, sizeof(AreaConfig));
02094

02214 /**
02215  Function        EnableZone
02216  PreCondition:    None
02217  Side Effects:    bypass, isolated and arming flags
02218  Overview:
02219  will clear the bypass, isolated and arming flag for the zone provided
02220  Should only be called as a task. Can take 2 runs to complete task
02221  @param           Zone ID
02222  @result          None
02223 
02224 */
02225 
02226 void EnableZone (int TheZone) {
02227 
02228         // It can be isolated and bypassed at the same time.
02229 
02230         // If the zone is bypassed send
02231         // security.zone
02232         //  event=bypassed
02233         // area=id
02234         // state=false
02235         // clear the bypassed flag
02236 
02237 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02238         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Enabling Zone\r\n");
02239 #endif
02240 
02241 
02242 
02243         if (ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsBypassed) {
02244 
02245                 //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
02246                 if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
02247 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02248                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# EnableZone, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
02249 #endif
02250                 }
02251                 else {
02252 
02253                         // Generate xPL head with type security.zone
02254                         XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Zone);
02255                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "event=bypassed\nzone=");
02256                         itoa(TheZone, xPLMsgKey);
02257                         UDPPutArray(xPLMsgKey,strlen(xPLMsgKey));
02258                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\nstate=false\n}\n");
02259                         UDPFlush();
02260                 }//UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)
02261 
02262                 ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsBypassed = FALSE;
02263 
02264                 // return back after a TCIP stack task run has occured to complete the Isolated message
02265                 if (ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsIsolated == FALSE) ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
02266 
02267         } // IsBypassed
02268 
02269         else if (ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsIsolated) {
02270 
02271                 //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
02272                 if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
02273 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02274                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# EnableZone, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
02275 #endif
02276                 }
02277                 else {
02278 
02279                         // Generate xPL head with type security.zone
02280                         XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Zone);
02281                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "event=isolated\nzone=");
02282                         uitoa(TheZone, xPLMsgKey);
02283                         UDPPutArray(xPLMsgKey,strlen(xPLMsgKey));
02284                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\nstate=false\n}\n");
02285                         UDPFlush();
02286                 }//UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)
02287 
02288                 ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsIsolated = FALSE;
02289                 ZoneConfig[TheZone].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
02290 
02291                 //now save the changes
02292                 xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));
02293 
02294         } // IsIsolated
02295 } //EnableZone
02296

02299 /**
02300  Function        EnableArea
02301  PreCondition:    None
02302  Side Effects:    bypass, isolated flag
02303  Overview:
02304  will set the bypass flag for the area provided
02305  also sets the flag for any zones that are related
02306  @param           Area ID
02307  @result          None
02308 
02309 */
02310 
02311 void EnableArea (int TheArea) {
02312 
02313 
02314         // It can be isolated and bypassed at the same time.
02315 
02316         // If the area is bypassed send
02317         // security.area
02318         // { event=bypassed
02319         // area=id
02320         // state=false }
02321         // clear the bypassed flag
02322 
02323 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02324         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Enable Area\r\n");
02325 #endif
02326 
02327         AreaConfig[TheArea].IsChangeFlagged = FALSE;
02328 
02329         if (AreaConfig[TheArea].IsBypassed) {
02330 
02331                 //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
02332                 if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
02333 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02334                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# EnableArea, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
02335 #endif
02336                 }
02337                 else {
02338 
02339                         // Generate xPL head with type security.zone
02340                         XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Area);
02341                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "area=");
02342                         UDPPut('0'+ TheArea);
02343                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\nbypassed=false\n}\n");
02344                         UDPFlush();
02345                 }//UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)
02346 
02347                 AreaConfig[TheArea].IsBypassed = FALSE;
02348 
02349                 // cycle through all zones and set their flags to true clear if they are a member of this area
02350                 for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
02351                         if (isZoneMemberOfArea(iCount, TheArea)) {
02352                                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsBypassed = FALSE;
02353                         }// ZoneConfig
02354                 }// for iCount
02355 
02356         } // IsBypassed
02357 
02358 
02359         // if area is isolated then send
02360         // security.area
02361         // { event=isolated
02362         // area=id
02363         // state=false }
02364         // clear the isolated flag
02365 
02366 
02367         if (AreaConfig[TheArea].IsIsolated) {
02368 
02369                 //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
02370                 if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
02371 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
02372                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# EnableArea, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
02373 #endif
02374                 }
02375                 else {
02376 
02377                         // Generate xPL head with type security.zone
02378                         XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Security,Type_Area);
02379                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "area=");
02380                         UDPPut('0'+TheArea);
02381                         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\nisolated=false\n}\n");
02382                         UDPFlush();
02383                 }//UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)
02384 
02385                 AreaConfig[TheArea].IsIsolated = FALSE;
02386 
02387                 // cycle through all zones and set their flags to true clear if they are a member of this area
02388                 for (iCount = 0; iCount < ZONECOUNT; iCount++) {
02389                         if (isZoneMemberOfArea(iCount, TheArea) == TRUE) {
02390                                 ZoneConfig[iCount].IsIsolated = FALSE;
02391                         }// ZoneConfig
02392                 }// for iCount
02393 
02394         } // IsIsolated
02395 
02396         //now save the changes
02397         xPLSaveEEConfig(ZoneConfig, EEDATASTART_ZONE, sizeof(ZoneConfig));
02398         xPLSaveEEConfig(AreaConfig, EEDATASTART_AREA, sizeof(AreaConfig));
02399 
02400 }
